intro: Galathenium floridanum, commonly known as Florida bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in pine flatwoods and scrub habitats. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Galathenium floridanum is often found in open, sunny areas and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
